description:
I noticed that queues created for DirectConsumer objects remain alive until RabbitMQ is restarted. They should be marked as 'Exclusive' as well as 'Auto_Delete' if the effect wanted is for them to go away as soon as the consumer closes the connection.

Not sure whether this is a bug or not, but the DirectConsumer queue's topics are UUIDs, so what's the point of having them 'Non exclusive'?
title: RabbitMQ DirectConsumer queue

comments.content:

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~armando-migliaccio

comments.content: UUIDs work fine too, but the proper way to do it using the exclusive feature in the queuing API. It won't hurt to have this just in case we want to change queue names as well. It also looks like auto delete was also enabled for DirectConsumer.
